ext2

Class Helper

  • java.lang.Object
    • ext2.Helper

  • public class Helper
extends java.lang.Object
    Name: Helper This class provides methods for outputting various file system information. An instance of this class must be created before user can use these methods.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Helper()
      Constructor to initialise the Helper instance variables.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void dumpHexBytes(byte[] bytes)
      This method displays a block as a set of hex and corresponding ASCII values.
      java.lang.String getHexBytesString(byte[] bytes)
      Returns the string containing all the bytes specified by the user.
      void printFileInfo(Ext2File ext)
      Outputs useful information for a particular Ext2File passed in.
      void printFurtherSuperBlockInfo(SuperBlock superBlock)
      Method to print further information derived from the super block data.
      void printINodeInfo(INode iNode)
      Outputs all fields relevant to a given iNode.
      void printPointers(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> pointers)
      Prints out the dynamic list of pointer integers specified by the user.
      void printSuperblockInfo(SuperBlock superBlock)
      Method to print all information containined within the superblock.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Helper

        public Helper()
        Constructor to initialise the Helper instance variables.

    • Method Detail

      • dumpHexBytes

        public void dumpHexBytes(byte[] bytes)
        This method displays a block as a set of hex and corresponding ASCII values. ASCII codes are printed alongside the hex codes. The method also handles having too few bytes!
        Parameters:
        bytes - The array of bytes to output in hex format.

      • printSuperblockInfo

        public void printSuperblockInfo(SuperBlock superBlock)
        Method to print all information containined within the superblock. The superblock holds characteristics of the filesystem. Further information is printed, which is derived from the superblock fields.
        Parameters:
        superBlock - The super block to print information for.

      • printFurtherSuperBlockInfo

        public void printFurtherSuperBlockInfo(SuperBlock superBlock)
        Method to print further information derived from the super block data. The superblock holds characteristics of the filesystem. Further information is printed, which is derived from the superblock fields.
        Parameters:
        superBlock - The super block to print information for.

      • printINodeInfo

        public void printINodeInfo(INode iNode)
        Outputs all fields relevant to a given iNode.
        Parameters:
        iNode - The iNode to print information for.

      • printFileInfo

        public void printFileInfo(Ext2File ext)
        Outputs useful information for a particular Ext2File passed in.
        Parameters:
        ext - The Ext2File instance to print information for.

      • printPointers

        public void printPointers(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> pointers)
        Prints out the dynamic list of pointer integers specified by the user.
        Parameters:
        pointers - The dynamic list of pointers to print.

      • getHexBytesString

        public java.lang.String getHexBytesString(byte[] bytes)
        Returns the string containing all the bytes specified by the user. This method obtains the byte string without printing to the console.
        Parameters:
        bytes - The array of bytes to generate a string for.
        Returns:
        The string containing all the bytes provided in the array.
